intro: Xanthoxalis sternbergii, commonly known as the yellow false penny-cress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing herb with a fibrous root system and basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Xanthoxalis sternbergii is adapted to arid environments and is considered a member of the Brassicaceae family.
